column1: The Paycheck Protection Program has saved more than 6000 small businesses in #TX25 during COVID-19.  Over $130 billion still remains unused — it’s time for Speaker Pelosi to quit playing politics so we can deliver this funding to Main Street and save Texan jobs. #LetsWork https://t.co/WFzgQ9tLXw

Thank you to our all of our #TX25 rural health care providers for your determination and selflessness especially during COVID-19. I’m proud to represent these front line heroes and will continue working to deliver relief so they can best serve Texans. #NationalRuralHealthDay https://t.co/ITJ8KC7x3L

Music venues across #TX25 are still facing catastrophic losses due to COVID-19. It’s crucial we bring the Save Our Stages Act up for a vote as a standalone bill so we can deliver this bipartisan victory for Texans.  WATCH my remarks below ⬇️ https://t.co/2lXTeu0PAi
More encouraging news in the fight against COVID-19. The development of a vaccine is crucial to our nation's recovery from the pandemic. https://t.co/RdSB5FrszU

Unbelievable. Rather than work toward a path forward for the American people during COVID-19 House Democrats are once again attempting to let Members of Congress collect a paycheck while not showing up to vote on behalf of those who elected them. https://t.co/HHF5M1SWQY

A potentially life-saving COVID-19 vaccine is labeled as “bad news” by Democrats because it happened under the Trump administration.  Disgusting — but not surprising for the Left. https://t.co/BWuhF1ObBh

Encouraging #JobsReport for our nation!   “...employers added 638000 jobs and sent unemployment down sharply amid signs the economy is healing from the pandemic-induced downturn.”  The #GreatAmericanComeback continues as we rebound from COVID-19 🇺🇸 https://t.co/NOaaWXwBBX

I’m proud to have delivered results to curb shortfalls during COVID-19 but endless spending isn’t the answer – we need principled policies that will move us forward toward brighter days. I have no doubt that Texas will emerge stronger than ever. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/ETiC7H3TVF

Great to stop by Wimberley Cafe this morning with the Chamber of Commerce to talk about our impressive Q3 economic growth and the path forward during COVID-19.  I’ll always support pro-worker pro-America policies and I have full faith that we’ll come back stronger than ever. https://t.co/OW3yvHylox

Great visiting with employees at La Moderna’s impressive 150000 square foot state-of-the-art facility in Cleburne to discuss the adaptations they’ve had to make during COVID-19 the latest on vaccine development and how our Texas economy is poised for recovery. https://t.co/auKmOWYdHC

Great to join local officials and business and educational leaders from Central Texas to discuss what our #TX25 community needs in the next COVID-19 relief package and how we can partner together to support our Fort Hood community. https://t.co/1FWnV1n4z1

Great to join Hillsboro business owners for a forum today discussing the urgency of greater relief during COVID-19 — while we’ve made great progress injecting capital into Main Street we must provide further targeted aid so our economy can rebound quickly. #TX25 #smallbiz https://t.co/8YrCLZ20x7

Great to join Texans in Bosque County this morning for a forum on the path forward during COVID-19 and my efforts to expand reliable high quality broadband access to our #TX25 rural communities. #EliminatetheDigitalDivide https://t.co/Z1zrzrguQg

There’s no question that COVID-19 has dealt a devastating blow to our nation but I am committed to restoring our economic dominance and REBUILDING the greatest economy we’ve had in generations.   #CommitmenttoAmerica https://t.co/rss4TDTxB5

Technical Chemical Company employs 325 workers in Cleburne — and thanks to the Paycheck Protection Program they did not have to let go of any of their employees during COVID-19. It was great to tour their impressive facility and discuss the future of their operation. https://t.co/RbZeneUrex

While we’ve come a long way there is still work to be done. I’ll continue partnering with our innovative private sector local officials and @POTUS so #TX25 can recover and rebound from COVID-19. Together we’ll build a stronger Texas.

While the economic effects of COVID-19 are devastating our economy is poised for recovery.  We should focus on cutting regulations and making individual tax cuts permanent so more money can flow into our economy and workers. My column in @ctrnews ➡️ https://t.co/4wUzJY53LT https://t.co/FbsjGXBPN7

It was a privilege speaking to the Tuesday Forum in Cleburne today. Texas small businesses are the heartbeat of our economy and I’ll continue doing all I can to help Main Street rebound from COVID-19 so America can emerge stronger than ever. #TX25 🇺🇸 https://t.co/EjmJaXyd8y

Thank you to Lisa and Mike for the tour of Learning Express Toys in Bee Cave. Small businesses like theirs in #TX25 are the backbone of our economy — so they can rebound even quicker from COVID-19 I’m committed to cutting taxes & regulations to allow for more growth and freedom. https://t.co/jsSGgqF025

Our rural hospitals are vital to the wellbeing of our #TX25 communities and have stepped up to serve their patients during COVID-19 despite facing unprecedented challenges.   That’s why I remain committed to fighting for greater relief on their behalf ⬇️ https://t.co/nd7ar6b8i7

“U.S. families’ income and wealth rose in the years heading into the coronavirus pandemic with those in lower-income and lower-wealth categories reaping relatively large gains...”  I’m working to ensure Texans rebound from COVID-19 stronger than ever ⬇️ https://t.co/qDxHujaX46

The #FarmerstoFamiliesFoodBox Program surpassed 100 MILLION boxes distributed to support American farmers and families affected by #COVID19. I was grateful for the opportunity to help deliver these boxes filled with fruits and vegetables to Texans in Cleburne earlier this year. https://t.co/Z6nzAZp07b

It's crucial our hospitals receive more relief so they can provide our communities with the highest level of care possible while we recover from COVID-19.  I'm proud to lead the effort with @RepEBJ urging @HHSGov to provide them with additional funding. https://t.co/AvUWblE88j

Grateful for the opportunity to deliver more masks to Lake Travis High School as students and faculty begin returning for the new school year. Thank you to all of our educators for your commitment to providing critical learning resources for students during COVID-19. #TX25 https://t.co/0OzwbsOBzI

The #SaveOurStagesAct would provide a lifeline for Broken Spoke and hundreds of other venues across Central Texas facing devastation from COVID-19. I’m proud to champion this effort in Congress and will continue fighting for these community staples.  WATCH more from @cbsaustin ⬇️ https://t.co/AGgwtKKek2

🚨Rather than deliver more relief for Texans and the American people—even utilizing existing coronavirus relief funds—Democrats once again decided to push their own political agenda. It’s shameful. https://t.co/t2RmhVFuBg

The Texas National Guard has been instrumental in serving our Central Texas communities during COVID-19. Grateful for the opportunity to receive a briefing at Camp Mabry today on their response efforts and to learn more about their mission protecting our southern border. https://t.co/fNuLtHAQRF

Independent live music venues are facing tremendous losses due to COVID-19. The bipartisan #SaveOurStagesAct would provide a lifeline for survival.  Honored to join artists venue owners and promoters at Broken Spoke in Austin highlighting the urgency of passing this legislation! https://t.co/8R2Z8HaOqa

Burnet Co. has received over $1.5 million in COVID-19 relief under the CARES Act. I was grateful for the opportunity to host a roundtable with local officials & business owners from the Burnet & Marble Falls community today as we partner together to continue on the path forward. https://t.co/xG0fRgd6hT

Great to host a roundtable in Johnson County with local leaders highlighting our partnership and shared goals as we serve Texans. I’m proud to have delivered over $10 million in relief to the county for education infrastructure repairs and residential assistance during COVID-19. https://t.co/sVyLTlPAob

It’s crucial that we extend telehealth coverage so our rural #TX25 communities are able to access essential care well beyond COVID-19. I’m proud to introduce the Ensuring Telehealth Expansion Act to improve the cost-effective delivery of these services ⬇️ https://t.co/uXau35sc5P

The #SaveOurStagesAct would save community staples like Hudson’s on Mercer Street in Dripping Springs and provide relief to survive and recover from COVID-19. It was great to tour their venue today and learn more about their dedication to the #TX25 community.  #SaveOurStages https://t.co/5azfXC7bDO

The Dripping Springs Chocolate Company was started as a family-owned business in 2016. Thanks to pro-growth policies and the PPP that I’ve been proud to champion in Congress they’ve been able to expand over the last few years and adapt to changes during COVID-19. #TX25 https://t.co/9eM6gx48qr

Telehealth flexibilities under the CARES Act have tremendously helped both patients and providers during COVID-19 and it’s vital we extend these waivers. I’m proud to introduce the Ensuring Telehealth Expansion Act to protect our rural communities ⬇️ https://t.co/N2OQmpprRY

Great morning with Cleburne leaders hearing about how area businesses and industries are creatively adapting to COVID-19 and their optimistic economic outlook thanks to the CARES Act.  I’ll keep working to deliver resources so #TX25 Main Street businesses can continue rebounding. https://t.co/1TnFBRUE0m

Rural hospitals have risen to meet their patients’ needs despite historic financial losses during COVID-19.  I’m proud to partner with organizations like @torchnet as I  continue delivering relief for Texans & fight for our rural health care facilities ⬇️ https://t.co/rJNLJopdt7

Venues like the Plaza Theatre Company in Cleburne are staples in our community but during COVID-19 they’ve faced losses that threaten to close their doors for good.   The #SaveOurStagesAct would provide the relief they need to continue their next act ⬇️ https://t.co/nlit17xMdS

Thanks to the Texas Organization of Rural and Community Hospitals and the National Rural Health Association for joining our virtual health care roundtable this morning discussing the crucial need for tele-health services my bill to delay the MFAR and challenges during COVID-19. https://t.co/Yg0YiumuPC

The SOS Act would provide aid to music venues across #TX25 like the Plaza Theatre in Cleburne. Great to meet with leadership from Southwestern Adventist University along with Keene community leaders today. H.R. 8015 was nothing more than a politically-motivated stunt — the Democrats wasted precious time today that should have been devoted to providing relief for the American people during COVID-19.  My full statement ➡️ https://t.co/zPsBE6tK8r https://t.co/8bRG4zJVGH

Instead of working on COVID-19 relief for families and small businesses @SpeakerPelosi called the House back to D.C. for an “emergency” session to vote on a manufactured crisis.  Americans deserve better. https://t.co/HUGkml414Y
